byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, and Carlotta Gall from Algiers.
byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE

abstract: Lebanese state-run news agency reports Hannibal el-Qaddafi, youngest son of former Libyan leader Col Muammar el-Qaddafi, has been handed over to Lebanese security forces by militants who wish to avenge cleric Moussa al-Sadr, who disappeared in Libya in 1970s.
lead_paragraph: The National News Agency said the son, Hannibal Qaddafi, who appeared in a video broadcast on Lebanese television, was seized Thursday by kidnappers.

headline.main: Qaddafi’s Son Hannibal Is Said to Be Abducted in Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Qaddafi Son Said to Be Seized in Lebanon

snippet: The National News Agency said the son, Hannibal Qaddafi, who appeared in a video broadcast on Lebanese television, was seized Thursday by kidnappers.
